children.text: There are holes drilled through the top plates near the edge, not in the centre.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 1684 Residential Timber-Framed Construction, clause 6.2.1.4 Notching, Trenching and Holes in Studs and Plates states that
‘Holes in studs and plates shall be located
within the middle half of the depth
and breadth of the member respectively, and that a maximum hole of 25mm in diameter may be drilled through the wide face of a plate’ .
As these holes are not in the middle half of the frame, these members will have to be properly trimmed/strengthened, or otherwise replaced.
